moves.1. e4 e5 2. Qh5: White tries to fool black- 2. Qh5 g6 - and get his rook but black realises and protects the pawn.
moves.2... Nc6 3. Bc4: An attempt of the 4 move check mate.
moves.3... g6: Now black threatens the queen and stops the mate.
moves.4. Qf3: The mate is still on.  5. Qf7#
moves.4... Nf6: Black defends the mate and develops another piece.
moves.5. d3 Bb4+: Black tries an early check but realy there was not much point.
moves.9. h3 h6: Black forces the bishop to either make a trade or retreat his bishop.
moves.10. Bxf6+ Qxf6: Black accepts the trade and also offers a queen swap..... but.......
moves.12. Bb3 Nxb3: he takes the bishop but allows white to free his doubled up pawns.
Black forces the white queen to retreat.
moves.17. Qe3 Rfd8: Black is targeting the pawn on d3.
moves.18... Rd7: he is trying to double up his rooks
moves.20. d4: white advances from the vulnerable square.
moves.20... exd4 21. cxd4: A fair swap but black has the advantage with the doubled up rooks.
moves.21... c5 22. Ne5: white was going to lose a pawn anyways.
moves.29. Qc3: A good counter - pinning the rook
moves.29... Qe3+ 30. Kh1 f6: defends the rook with another piece.
moves.31. Rxd3 Qe1+ 32. Kh2 Qh4+: wow thats a change - no swap?? but good attacking play and forces 33. kg1
moves.33. Kg1 Re1+ 34. Qxe1: forced and black earns himself a queen.
moves.48... Kf8: black need to move his king so he is then able to move is queen. if not 48. g4 Q3 49. Rb8#
moves.49. f6 Qxf3: Black doesn't realise that the pawn is covering e7 and falls in whites trap.
